snippet: The amount of data being generated globally increases by 40 percent a year, creating new opportunities for a multitude of software start-ups.
abstract: Splunk is among a crop of enterprise software start-up companies that analyze big data and are establishing themselves in territory long controlled by giant business-technology vendors like Oracle and IBM; amount of data being generated globally increases by 40 percent a year.

headline.main: For Start-Ups That Aim at Giants, Sorting the Data Cloud Is the Next Big Thing
headline.print_headline: For Start-Ups That Aim at Giants, Sorting the Data Cloud Is the Next Big Thing

snippet: Cee Lo Green, an entertainer devoted to the Liberace and Elton John school of showmanship, will earn about $20 million this year, and only a fraction of that is from his music.
abstract: Singer Cee Lo Green is one of the hardest-working stars in pop music, and will earn about $20 million in 2011, although only a fraction of that is from his music; outside of performing, he promotes himself through his talk show, other television shows and product endorsements.

headline.main: Cee Lo Strikes Gold, Without a Gold Album
headline.print_headline: Striking Gold, Without a Gold Album

snippet: Scholars are trying to recover the literary history of word processing, one casual deletion and trashed document at a time, starting with writers like Stephen King and Frank Herbert.
abstract: English professor Matthew G Kirschenbaum explores the literary history of word processing and how the technology has shaped writers' creativity in his upcoming book Track Changes: A Literary History of Word Processing.

headline.main: The Muses of Insert, Delete and Execute
headline.print_headline: The Muses of Insert, Delete and Execute

snippet: A new series from an innovative publishing firm aims to meld the cultures of e-books and printed ones.
abstract: A new series from an innovative publishing firm aims to meld the cultures of e-books and printed ones.

headline.print_headline: The New Book Beyond the Book

snippet: As you open your Kindle or iPad on Christmas, consider this publisher who suggests that e-books and print books can live peacefully together.
abstract: As you open your Kindle or iPad on Christmas, consider this publisher who suggests that e-books and print books can live peacefully together.

snippet: Sami Steigmann volunteers up to 60 hours some weeks, his way of giving back to a city that has helped him.
abstract: Community Service Society of New York, one of seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, gives transportation stipend to Sami Steigmann to help cover his costs as a volunteer greeter for New York City.

headline.main: Getting a Helping Hand After Giving Back to the City
headline.print_headline: Prolific Volunteer In the City Gets a Helping Hand

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Community Service Society of New York

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund

snippet: Il Palio, housed in a formidable, white stone building, offers Italian cuisine, prepared by a chef with impeccable credentials.
abstract: Stephanie Lyness reviews Il Palio Restaurant in Shelton (Metropolitan/Connecticut).

headline.main: Italian Cuisine, Guided by a Native
headline.print_headline: Italian Cuisine, Guided by a Native

snippet: In a sense, Ritchie, the creator of C and co-author of the book “The C Programming Language,” has enabled us to all become programmers.
abstract: Author Ellen Ullman pays tribute to computer programmer Dennis Ritchie, who died in 2011 and is included in Times Magazine The Lives They Lived issue.
